subject: Productivity
title: The Cost of Context Switching
description: A quick, practical guide to The Cost of Context Switching.

hook.text: Every time you switch tasks, your brain pays a hidden tax. Researchers call it a switch cost.

buildup.text: Context switching forces the brain to reload rules, goals, and information for the new task.

discovery.text: Studies show each switch can cost 15 to 25 minutes of productive focus, even for brief interruptions.

twist.text: Multitasking feels efficient but creates constant switching costs. Net productivity drops by up to 40%.

climax.text: Single-tasking isn't outdated. It's the brain's design specification.

punchline.text: Every switch costs more than you think.

quiz.question: How much can multitasking reduce net productivity?
